column2:
Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)
column3:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary accurately represents the information from the reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary accurately represents the information from the reference text.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than A (Score 2)

Explanation:
When comparing the summaries, consider the accuracy and completeness of the information presented in each summary. If both summaries accurately capture the key findings and details from the reference text without introducing false information, the score should be 0. If one summary provides a more comprehensive and accurate representation of the information, it should be scored accordingly. Ensure that the scoring reflects the degree to which one summary is more accurate than the other based on the information provided in the reference text.

column2: [('since the prior study, there has been development of an approximately 1.7 cm homogeneous mucus retention cyst or polyp in the left maxillary sinus. there has been no change in the right maxillary mucus retention cyst. also unchanged is soft tissue density across the left maxillary sinus drainage pathway. there remains minimal left maxillary mucosal thickening. again demonstrated are changes of endoscopic sinus surgery. the cribriform plates are symmetric. the lamina papyracea are intact. the sphenoid sinus septum inserts on the left carotid groove. the anterior clinoid processes are not pneumatized.', -2, 1.0), ('no evidence of acute intracranial hemorrhage or large vascular territory infarction is seen. periventricular and subcortical white matter hypodensities are previously seen, likely due to chronic small vessel ischemic disease. allowing for differences in patient positioning during acquisition of images, size of the ventricles are likely not changed substantially. sulcal and ventricular prominence is likely due to age-related involutional change. however, there may be slight increase in the periventricular white matter hypodensities surrounding the occipital horns bilaterally, which could represent evolution of chronic small vessel white matter disease. vascular calcifications are noted along the intracranial vertebral and internal carotid arteries. images are degraded by motion; however, the soft tissues, orbits, and skull appear intact. the visualized paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells are normally aerated.', -1, 2.0), ('there is persistent high density subdural hemorrhage at the right vertex. the right frontal aspect of the previously noted subdural hematoma has decreased in size. there has been interval removal of the subdural drain. there is a decrease in the mass effect evident on the prior study with slight residual subfalcine herniation. the ventricles are not enlarged, and there is no major or minor vascular territorial infarcts.', -1, 1.0), ('no acute intracranial hemorrhage, edema, mass effect or major vascular territorial infarction. ventricles and sulci are normal in size and configuration. there is no shift of normally midline structures. soft tissues appear unremarkable. there is a small right subgaleal hematoma. no fractures are seen. patient is intubated. imaged paranasal sinuses and mastoid air cells demonstrate minimal mucosal thickening and partial opacification of the anterior ethmoid air cells on the left. this study is limited due to streak artifact coming from posterior and exterior to the patient.', 0, 2.0), ('there is some persistence of the high density in the region of the sulci consistent with subarachnoid blood but it is reduced compared with the former examination. there is also reduction in the amount of interventricular density. ventricular dimensions unchanged. the ventricular catheter is unchanged in position. there is no evidence of a new extra-axial fluid collection. low density in the region of the right thalamus representing an infarction is unchanged.', 0, 1.0), ('air fluid levels and aerosolization of secretions are seen within the frontal sinus, and opacifying the frontal- ethmoid recess. mild mucosal thickening is also seen within the ethmoid air cells. in addition, there are regions of aerosolized secretions within the right side of the ethmoid air cells. air fluid levels and aerosolized secretions are also seen within both partitions of the multiseptate sphenoid sinus, and air fluid levels with mild mucosal thickening are seen within the maxillary sinuses. as described on prior facial ct, there are extensive fractures, including the left zygomatic arch, the lateral wall of the left orbit, the left frontal bone, as well as the left side of the skull base. opacification of the mastoid air cells is also seen on both left and the right. vascular calcifications of the internal carotid arteries are also present. note is made of a prominent left nasal septal spur and septal deviation. in addition, there is an partially erupted left molar tooth.', 0, 2.0)]
